info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 4:14PM CST until December 15 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CST FOR EAST CENTRAL GEARY...SOUTHEASTERN RILEY...NORTHWESTERN SHAWNEE... NORTHERN WABAUNSEE...EASTERN POTTAWATOMIE...JACKSON...NEMAHA AND WESTERN BROWN COUNTIES... At 413 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles south of Humboldt to near Alma, moving east at 50 mph. Tornado warning remains in effect for northeast Pottawatomie and southwest Jackson County. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR the warned area. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Wamego, Holton, Sabetha, Seneca, Rossville, Alma, St. Marys, Silver Lake, Onaga, St. George, Maple Hill, Centralia, Wetmore, Fairview, McFarland, Morrill, Paxico, Belvue, Emmett and Louisville. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 313 and 354. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for northeastern Kansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
